fields.name: Advanced object viewer
fields.description: Displays any input.

fields.name: C#.NET Snippet
fields.description: Runs c#.NET snippet. You can use variable which is provided on the input by the name "in1" .. "inN". Whatever you want to otput needs to be asigned to the variable "out1" before the code is terminated

fields.name: Load Document Corpus From File
fields.description: This widges processes raw text file and loads the texts into ADC (Annotated Document Corpus) structure. The input file contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document. In case lines contain more document properties (i.e.: ids, titles, labels,...) than other widgets should be used to load ADC structure.

fields.name: Load Document Corpus From String
fields.description: This widges processes raw text file and loads the texts into ADC (Annotated Document Corpus) structure. The input file contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document. In case lines contain more document properties (i.e.: ids, titles, labels,...) than other widgets should be used to load ADC structure.

fields.name: Stem/Lemma Tagger Hub
fields.description: Taggs the given annotated document corpus with the given tagger.

fields.name: Python Snippet
fields.description: Runs python snippet. You can use variable which is provided on the input by the name "in1" .. "inN". Whatever you want to otput needs to be asigned to the variable "out1" before the code is terminated

fields.name: String
fields.description: string or array of strings (based on the input)

fields.name: out
fields.description: output can be accesed/assigned as variable "out1" inside the code

fields.name: String
fields.description: string or array of strings (based on the input)

fields.name: out
fields.description: output can be accesed/assigned as variable "_out" inside the code

fields.name: The Rest of Annotated Document Corpus
Raw Text File
fields.description: Input Text File: Contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document.

fields.name: Annotation to be tokenized
fields.description: Which annotated part of document to be splited

fields.name: Annotation to be produced
fields.description: How to annotate found sentences

fields.name: Filter
Token Tagger
fields.default:
Output feature name specifies how the token will be tagged (assigend the feature to)
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.
fields.description:
Token Annotation of the token to be tagged. If also the feature name is used than the feature value of selected token will be tagged.
Usage: 
1.TokenName
2. TokenName/FatureName
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.

fields.name: Token Annotation [ / Feature Name ] (one line per each tagger)
fields.description:
Token Annotation of the token to be tagged. If also the feature name is used than the feature value of selected token will be tagged.
Usage: 
1.TokenName
2. TokenName/FatureName
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.

fields.name: Output Feature Name (one line per each tagger)
fields.description:
Output feature name specifies how the token will be tagged (assigend the feature to)
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.

fields.name: Stopwords
fields.description: List of stopwords - either as list or in a single string (one stopword per line)

fields.name: Ignore Case
fields.description: If true than words are marked stopword regardless of their casing.

fields.name: in
fields.description: input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code

fields.name: Object Modifier
fields.description: if one wants to extract object's attributes, leading dot should be used.

fields.name: Python Snippet Code
fields.default:
# This is the Python Code Snippet where you can modify the data however is needed.
# Varaible "in1" .. "inN" contains whatever you connected to the input port
# Whatever is assigned to the variable "out1" will be transfered to the output port.

out1 = in1
fields.description: Input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code and output can be accesed/assigned as variable "out1" inside the code.

fields.name: Object
fields.description: Any type of object.

fields.name: Attribute
fields.description: The depth of the object display

fields.name: Annotation to be tokenized
fields.description: Which annotated part of document to be splited

fields.name: Annotation to be produced
fields.description: How to annotate found sentences

fields.name: Type
Feature Condition
fields.description:
Condition which tokens to include based on their features.
Format examples:
-Feature1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set ta any value)
-Feature1=Value1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to the value Value1)
-Feature1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set unless it has also Feature2 set)
-Feature1=Value1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to Value1 unless it has also Feature2 set to any value)
...

fields.name: Feature Condition
fields.description:
Condition which tokens to include based on their features.
Format examples:
-Feature1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set ta any value)
-Feature1=Value1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to the value Value1)
-Feature1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set unless it has also Feature2 set)
-Feature1=Value1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to Value1 unless it has also Feature2 set to any value)
...

fields.name: Put token/feature text as the output feature value
fields.description: If set to true than token or token's feature text is asigned as output feature value

fields.name: Token Tagger
fields.description: string or array of strings

fields.name: Annotation to be tokenized
fields.description: Which annotated part of document to be splited

fields.name: Annotation to be produced
fields.description: How to annotate found sentences

fields.name: in
fields.description: input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code

fields.name: C# Snippet Code
fields.description: Input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code and output can be accesed/assigned as variable "out1" inside the code.

fields.name: Namespace Section (using directives)
First words in line with preceding exclamation (!) present labels
String
fields.description: Input Text String: Contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document.

fields.name: First words in line with preceding exclamation (!) present labels
C
fields.description: zero implies default value ([avg. x*x]^-1)

fields.name: Random Seed
fields.description: -1 for random (time dependet) random seed

fields.name: AlphaLoose: accept tokens that contain at least one alphabetic character
AlphaStrict: accept tokens that contain alphabetic characters only
AlphanumLoose: accept tokens that contain at least one alphanumeric character
AlphanumStrict: accept tokens that contain alphanumeric characters only
